docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 19 The Food and Drug Administration announced today that it would start an investigation into the artificial sweetener saccharin.

headline.main: SACCHARIN STUDY PLANNED BY F.D.A.; Agency to Finance Research Into Artificial Sweetener

docs.abstract: FDA announces it will finance Natl Acad of Sciences study of health hazards of saccharin; says study will include rev of Dr G T Bryan rept that he has used saccharin to produce cancer in bladders of mice; Bryan calls for curbs on saccharin's use but opposes total ban, news conf; describes his lab experiments'
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 19 The Food and Drug Administration announced today that it would start an investigation into the artificial sweetener saccharin.

byline.original: By RICHARD D. LYONS Special to The New York Times
